## DELIVERABLE 1   
*Methodological Note:*  
- Scope of work: treemaps and smart specialization graphs for technologies.   
- Treemaps indicate the number of patents, share, and rcas. Particularly useful for the dynamic analysis to see if a region decreased/increased its RCA into the most/least complex techs but also in the priorities previously identified.   
- Smart specialization graphs indicate relatedness density, complexity, and rcas.   
- Technological complexity is computed using the eigenvector reformulation from Hidalgo and Hausmann (2009) and adapted to patent data by Balland and Rigby (2017), also used by Balland and Boschma (2024) from SBS in the complexity traps report.   
- Data source: patent data from the OECD RegPat database; Aug. 2023 edition (latest available).      
- Tech level: prio (RIS priorities), wipo (36 categories), 3-digit and 4-digit CPCs.  
- Priorities are matched to a set of cpcs - identified exactly as in the previous report (see priority crosswalk below).  
- Spatial level: nuts1 and nuts2.    
- Time: 2018-2021 (2018, 2019, 2020 and 2021) and 2015-2018 (2015, 2016, 2017 and 2018).  
- Main article of reference: Balland, P.A., Boschma, R., Crespo, J. and Rigby, D. (2019) Smart Specialization policy in the EU: Relatedness, Knowledge Complexity and Regional Diversification, Regional Studies, 53 (9): 1252-1268.

## DELIVERABLE 2   
*Methodological Note:*  
- Scope of work: treemaps and smart specialization graphs for scientific fields.   
- Treemaps indicate the number of scientific publications, share, and rcas.     
- Smart specialization graphs indicate technological relatedness density, technological complexity (x axis and y axis are therefore identical to deliverable #1), and the size of bubbles is given by RCA in scientific fields.     
- Data source: scientific publications data from the OpenAlex database; last extracted Dec. 2023.      
- With 250 million publications OpenAlex is the largest dataset for academic publications in the world. OpenAlex replaced in 2021 the Microsoft Academic Graph.    
- Scientific level: prio (RIS priorities), wipo (36 categories).  
- Priorities and wipo categories are matched to OpenAlex scientific 'concepts'. Each scientific publication is classified into potentially multiple concepts, based on the title, abstract, and the title of the journal. The tagging is done using an automated AI classifier that was trained on Microsoft Academic Graph corpus (Read more about the methodology here: https://direct.mit.edu/qss/article/1/1/396/15572/Microsoft-Academic-Graph-When-experts-are-not). In total, there are about 65k concepts. For each year, we removed the concepts that belong to the bottom 25% category in terms of statistical confidence. Results are robust to sensitivity analysis in the confidence intervals.    
- Concepts are organized as a tree strucutre, and we matched prio/wipo categories to concepts using a keyword search (variation and subset until match at the most aggregated level). Often the category (for instance biotech) perfectly matches the concept. Sometimes we had to decompose the wipo/prio category into sub-level concepts and re-aggregate (see priority crosswalk below, that also include wipo).    
- Spatial level: nuts1 and nuts2.    
- Time: 2023 and 2024.   
- Main article of reference: Balland, P.A. & Boschma, R. (2022) Do scientific capabilities in specific domains matter for technological diversification in European regions?, Research Policy, 51 (10): 1-12.

## DELIVERABLE 4   
*Methodological Note:*  
- Scope of work: complementarity maps for technologies.   
- Complementarity scores indicate the added relatedness density for any region-region-tech triad.    
- Added relatedness density algorithm as developed by Balland and Boschma (2021).   
- Data source: patent data from the OECD RegPat database; Aug. 2023 edition (latest available).      
- Tech level: prio (RIS priorities).  
- Spatial level: nuts1 and nuts2.    
- Time: 2018-2021 (2018, 2019, 2020 and 2021).  
- Main article of reference: Balland, P.A. and Boschma, R. (2021) Complementary Inter-Regional Linkages and Smart Specialization: an Empirical Study on European Regions, Regional Studies, 55 (6): 1059-1070.
